summary: This bill, the PREVENT DIABETES Act, aims to expand the Medicare Diabetes Prevention Program (MDPP) by allowing virtual diabetes prevention program suppliers to participate. It mandates the Secretary of Health and Human Services to revise regulations by January 1, 2026, to include online MDPP services delivered through synchronous or asynchronous technology. The bill specifies enrollment conditions, addresses administrative location concerns, and removes limitations on re-enrollment in the MDPP. It defines key terms related to the MDPP, including MDPP supplier and MDPP beneficiary.
